conclusion: The electromotive force of the power supply is E=6V, the internal resistance is r=2Ω, the fixed resistors are R1=2Ω, R2=3Ω, R3=6Ω, and the capacitance of the capacitor is C=10μF.
After closing switch S, the circuit stabilizes.
Find the charge Q carried by the capacitor.
The charge Q carried by the capacitor is Q=CE.
The resistors R1 and R2 are in series, so their equivalent resistance is R1+R2=2Ω+3Ω=5Ω.
This equivalent resistance is in parallel with R3, so the total equivalent resistance is 1/R=1/5Ω+1/6Ω=11/30Ω, which simplifies to R=30/11Ω.
The total resistance of the circuit is the sum of the internal resistance r and the equivalent resistance R, which is r+R=2Ω+30/11Ω=52/11Ω.
The voltage across the capacitor is the same as the voltage across the resistors, which is E=6V.
Therefore, the charge Q carried by the capacitor is Q=CE=10μF×6V=60μC.
